DOC.brief_title: IRB-HSR # 14296 The Use Intrathoracic Pressure Regulator ( ITPR ) Improve Systemic Blood Pressure Patient Undergoing CABG Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: The ITPR FDA-approved device intend increase circulation blood pressure hypovolemic cardiogenic shock . The device insert within standard respiratory circuit patient ventilator . It function decrease intrathoracic pressure expiratory phase subatmospheric level positive pressure ventilation . The decrease intrathoracic pressure create vacuum within thorax relative rest body thereby enhance blood return heart consequently increase cardiac output blood pressure . Activation device also accompany decrease SVR . The end result device simultaneously improve cardiac output increase LVEDP/LVEDV decrease SVR increase coronary perfusion pressure increase blood pressure decrease LVESP/LVESV.1-8
DOC.criteria: 1. patient present elective CABG plan intraoperative TEE 2. age 18 year age old 3. informed consent obtain 1 . Patients plan valve surgery ( valve CABG + valve ) 2. patient contraindication transesophageal echocardiography ( TEE ) ; include patient extensive esophageal gastric disease . Relative contraindication include esophageal varix , Barrett 's esophagus , Zenker 's diverticulum , postradiation therapy esophageal area . 3. patient require IABP VAD preoperatively 4. emergent CABG 5. pneumothorax 6. hemothorax 7. uncontrolled bleed 8. uncontrolled hypertension define SBP > 180 mmHg time surgery
